title: Electro-Optical/Infrared Systems - Technology Trends Impact
text:
Electro-Optical/Infrared Systems - Technology Trends Impacting Military and Aerospace Sectors : Creating a Paradigm Shift in Target detection and Surveillance systems The technology trends of Electro-Optical/Infrared (EO-IR/EOIR) systems and its market implications will be determined by the ability to unleash an expanding world of application segments and opportunities- Embracing imaging and non-imaging technologies, EOIR technology promises to hold significantly high capability in military and aerospace sectors- The research service offers insights primarily on the current technology trends of Electro-Optical/Infrared technology and its future market implications in the military and defence sector- It also assesses applications that might evolve in the next 5 to 6 years- The scope of the research is restricted to classification of Electro-Optical/Infrared technology based on EOIR sensing technologies-
Key Findings
NEED FOR EO/IR SYSTEMS
Electro-Optical/Infrared systems are predominantly used in determining the distance and characteristics of a target-
They also play an important role in the development of thermal sensing technologies which sense an object's emitted IR radiation based on its temperature and form the building blocks of EOIR systems-
KEY FOCUS AREAS
EOIR systems are currently being deployed mainly for four applications-
They are target detection, surveillance, threat detection, range finding, and Intelligence algorithm development-
GLOBAL FOOTPRINT
North America leads the development of EOIR technologies, followed by the European Union and APAC-
However, emerging economies in Asia and South America are investing heavily on the adoption of EOIR systems in the military and aerospace sectors-
